OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Made the cancer spot in the main figure match the cancer in the inset (more orangy, bumpy).

Removed outer pink layer in the inset; changed Fat label to say "Fat around the bladder"; added back in the paravesical fat and put line from the label “Fat around the bladder” so that it points to that fat in addition to the fat layer in the inset; made cancer spot darker to distinguish it from the fat.

Removed perivesical fat around bladder; removed Peritoneum label; removed all lines from labels to little box on the main figure; added a line going from the top right and bottom right corners of little box on main figure to the top and bottom left corners on the inset.

Changed labels from Serosa to Fat, Lamina propria to Connective tissue, and Urothelium to Inner lining. Added color to show all the different layers in the inset. Made cancer spot in inset wider so overall spot looks bigger and not tall/skinny.

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage II bladder cancer; drawing shows the bladder, ureter, prostate, and urethra. Inset shows cancer in the inner lining of the bladder, the layer of connective tissue, and the muscle layers. Also shown is the layer of fat around the bladder.

Stage II bladder cancer; drawing shows the bladder, ureter, prostate, and urethra. Inset shows cancer in the inner lining of the bladder, the layer of connective tissue, and the muscle layers. Also shown is the layer of fat around the bladder.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage II bladder cancer. Cancer has spread to the layers of muscle tissue of the bladder.
Stage II bladder cancer. Cancer has spread to the layers of muscle tissue of the bladder.
